comment: API url for the source record in PlutoF referring to either material sample, specimen or living culture.
Same as bcdm:museumid and might match the bcdm:specimenid.
Multiple fieldId values possible in UNITE.
Same as bcdm:sampleid in case source material is held in a collection.
UNITE accession number for the sequence
Same as bcdm:process_id. It is mapped to dwc:occurrenceID which says that it does not need to be specimen but can be any type of occurrence
Each sequence belongs six different species hypotheses (SH); by default we use SH code at the 1.5% gap (distance) between sister species.

examples: University of Tartu; Natural History Museum and Botanical Garden; Natural History Museum; Mycological Collections

comment: Infraspecific epithet
Author name to be specified only in case identification is on species level.
We also have other options such as worker, soldier, and gynandromorph
List of elements: adult, larva/nymph, pupa, egg.
Type of source material (material sample, specimen, living culture), equivalent to mainform in PlutoF
ToDo: Public source record pages should be created on UNITE homepage.
object type: specimen
object type: taxonnode
Is part of unite:samplingevent_timespan_begin and unite:samplingevent_timespan_end
We only keep track of Alpha-3 ISO codes
Coordinate uncertainty in meters
Could be calculated on the fly if needed.
INSD accession number for the sequence

Check also GBIF DNA derived data extension - https://rs.gbif.org/extension/gbif/1.0/dna_derived_data_2021-07-05.xml#target_gene and https://rs.gbif.org/extension/gbif/1.0/dna_derived_data_2021-07-05.xml#target_subfragment. See also https://docs.gbif.org/publishing-dna-derived-data/en/.
Check also GBIF DNA derived data extension https://rs.gbif.org/extension/gbif/1.0/dna_derived_data_2021-07-05.xml#pcr_primers
Check GBIF DNA derived data extension https://rs.gbif.org/extension/gbif/1.0/dna_derived_data_2021-07-05.xml#pcr_primers
Source database the sequence originates from, can be either UNITE or INSDC.

examples: University of Tartu; Natural History Museum and Botanical Garden; Natural History Museum; Mycological Collections
